actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title IV of the Social Security Act to eliminate the present 10-percent limitation on the proportion of the total number of recipients of aid to families with dependent children in any State who may receive such aid in the form of restricted or protective payments.

summary.text: Amends Part A of title IV (Aid to Families with Dependent Children) of the Social Security Act to eliminate the ten percent limitation on the proportion of the total number of recipients of aid to families with dependent children in any State who may receive such aid in the form of restricted or protective payments.

titles.title: A bill to amend title IV of the Social Security Act to eliminate the present 10-percent limitation on the proportion of the total number of recipients of aid to families with dependent children in any State who may receive such aid in the form of restricted or protective payments.
